title: Digital $n-$Manifolds With Or Without Boundaries
abstract:
This work aims to define the concept of manifold, which has a very important
place in the topology, on digital images. So, a general perspective is provided
for two and three-dimensional imaging studies on digital curves and digital
surfaces. Throughout the study, the features present in topological manifolds
but that are not satisfied in the discrete version are specifically underlined.
In addition, other concepts closely related to manifolds such as submanifold,
orientation, and partition of unity are also discussed in digital images.
